page.title: 02CHURCHES
page.content: The village church of Belton is dedicated to SS. Peter and Paul. The church containes 39 visible monuments of which 30 represent the Brownlow or Cust family connection with the adjacent National Trust owned property.The other nine represent rectors of the parish or servants. St. Mary's,Syston is situated next to the courtyard of the Old Hall.There are numerous memorials to members of the Thorold family within the church. Barkston's church dates back to before the 12th century.Major restoration work was carried out in the late 1800's.The church is dedicated to St.Nicholas. Along with Honington parish the three parishes of Belton,Syston and Barkston form the living for a priest whose parsonage is located at Syston.
